meanings.definition: Make an abrupt, unsteady, jerky movement or series of movements.
meanings.sent1: The boat lurches in the rough waves.
meanings.sent2: She lurches forward as the train starts moving.
meanings.sent3: The clown lurches comically across the stage, trying to keep his balance.
meanings.sent4: His heart lurches with excitement as he opens the gift.
meanings.sent5: The car lurches to a stop, jolting everyone inside.

meanings.definition: An abrupt, unsteady, jerky movement or series of movements.
meanings.sent1: The sudden lurches of the roller coaster made her scream with delight.
meanings.sent2: He felt a lurch in his stomach as the elevator suddenly dropped.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected lurches of the old bus made the passengers hold on tight.
meanings.sent4: The market experienced a lurch in prices after the announcement.
meanings.sent5: The lurches of the earthquake caused buildings to sway dangerously.
